p: The attractiveness of borohydrides is that they form in various molecular structures. Boron–hydrogen chemistry is versatile (forming bridge and cyclic structures), and this could lead to improved tunability in cationic conduction. For example, nido- M +BH 4, closo-M 2+B 10H 10, closo-M +B 12H 12, and planar-M 6+B 6H 6 (with M = cations) can form ionic compounds with cations such as Li +, K +, Na +, Ca 2+, and Mg 2+. Anion structural renderings are shown in Figure 2. The closo-borane (-B 10H 10 2− and -B 12H 12 −) structures have open channels for ionic conduction [ 9].
